question: Based on the provided evidence, answer the following question: What position did David Richardson hold in 2030?. If the evidence is insufficient to answer the question, return 'INSUFFICIENT_INFORMATION'.

Title: The Honorable David Richardson: A Life of Judicial Service

In the esteemed halls of British justice, one name stands out among the many dedicated jurists who have served the nation with distinction: David Richardson, a respected circuit judge with a storied career marked by fairness, wisdom, and a deep commitment to upholding the law. Born and raised in the United Kingdom, David Richardson was drawn to the legal profession from a young age. He pursued his passion with diligence, earning a law degree from a prestigious university and subsequently being called to the bar. As he honed his skills in the courtroom, Richardson's exceptional abilities and strong work ethic quickly earned him recognition within the legal community. The turning point in Richardson's career came when he was appointed as a circuit judge, a position that would become synonymous with his name. This esteemed role, established in 1972, is a vital part of the British judicial system, with circuit judges presiding over a wide range of cases in the Crown Court and County Court. One of the most significant pieces of evidence supporting Richardson's position as a circuit judge is his inclusion in the official list of judges maintained by the UK's Judiciary website. This authoritative source confirms Richardson's status as a serving circuit judge, providing a clear and unequivocal endorsement of his position. Further evidence can be found in the numerous court transcripts and judgments that bear Richardson's name. These documents, available through public records, demonstrate his expertise and fairness in presiding over complex cases, from high-profile criminal trials to intricate civil disputes. The meticulous attention to detail and thoughtful consideration evident in his written judgments are a testament to Richardson's dedication to justice and his role as a circuit judge. Richardson's reputation as a respected and impartial jurist has also been recognized by his peers and the legal community at large. Colleagues and barristers who have appeared before him in court have consistently praised his ability to navigate the most challenging cases with ease, his deep understanding of the law, and his commitment to ensuring that justice is served. In addition to his work in the courtroom, Richardson has been an active participant in various judicial committees and working groups, contributing to the development of policies and procedures that shape the British justice system. His involvement in these initiatives has helped to inform and improve the administration of justice, further solidifying his position as a respected circuit judge. As David Richardson continues to serve the people of the United Kingdom with distinction, his legacy as a fair, wise, and dedicated circuit judge will undoubtedly endure.
content.source_2:
**David Richardson**

David Richardson is a British judge and politician who served as a member of the German Bundestag from 3 September 2027 to 26 December 2035. **Early Life and Career**

Richardson was born on 12 May 1965 in London, England. He studied law at the University of Cambridge, graduating with a Bachelor of Laws (LL.B.) degree in 1987. After completing his pupillage, he was called to the Bar of England and Wales in 1990. Richardson practiced law for over a decade, specializing in international trade law and arbitration. **Judicial Career**

In 2002, Richardson was appointed as a Recorder of the Crown Court, a part-time judicial position in the English judiciary. He served in this capacity for five years, presiding over criminal cases in the Crown Court. In 2007, he was elevated to the position of Circuit Judge, serving on the South Eastern Circuit. **Political Career**

Richardson's interest in politics led him to join the German liberal party, the Free Democratic Party (FDP), in 2015. He was attracted to the party's pro-European and economically liberal stance. After serving as a local councillor in Berlin from 2016 to 2022, Richardson was elected as a member of the German Bundestag in the 2027 federal election. **Member of the German Bundestag (2027-2035)**

Richardson took office as a member of the Bundestag on 3 September 2027, representing the Berlin constituency. During his tenure, he served on the Committee for European Affairs and the Committee for Legal Affairs. He was a vocal advocate for closer European integration and played a key role in shaping the German government's response to the European migrant crisis. In 2029, Richardson was appointed as the FDP's spokesperson for European affairs, a position he held until 2032. He was a strong supporter of the European Union's efforts to combat climate change and was instrumental in negotiating the EU's 2030 climate and energy package. **Resignation and Later Life**

Richardson resigned from the Bundestag on 26 December 2035, citing personal reasons. After leaving politics, he returned to the judiciary, serving as a judge on the Court of Appeal of England and Wales from 2036 to 2042. Richardson currently resides in Berlin, where he remains active in European politics as a senior fellow at the German Council on Foreign Relations.
